greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of integer partitions of n whose parts all have the same number of prime factors, counted with multiplicity.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2500 (first 101 terms from Chai Wah Wu)
example: The a(1) = 1 through a(9) = 6 integer partitions:
maple: b:= proc(n, i, f) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0,
b(n, i-1, f)+(o-> `if`(f in {0, o}, b(n-i, min(i, n-i),
mathematica: b[n, i-1, f] + Function[o, If[f == 0 || f == o, b[n-i, Min[i, n-i],
a /@ Range[0, 75] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 10 2021, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Oct 10 2018
